The '''International Jugglers' Association''' ('''IJA''') is the oldest and largest organization dedicated to the art of juggling. Founded in 1947, the IJA promotes juggling as a performing art, recreational activity, and competitive sport.

== Relevance to flow arts ==

While the IJA's primary focus is juggling, the organization has increasingly recognized [[flow arts]] disciplines. [[Noel Yee]] has presented at IJA festivals, bringing [[poi]] and other flow arts props to the juggling community.<ref name="noelyee-about">{{cite web |url=https://www.noelyee.com/about-me/ |title=About Me |publisher=Noel Yee |access-date=2026-02-08}}</ref>

The overlap between juggling and flow arts includes shared props such as [[Clubs (flow arts)|clubs]], [[Contact juggling|contact balls]], and [[Devil sticks|devil sticks]], as well as shared performance venues and festival circuits.
